metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4437 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache Shiro before 1.2.5, when a cipher key has not been configured for the "remember me" feature, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or bypass intended access restrictions via an unspecified request parameter.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4437` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libshiro-java - 1.3.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: shiro package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.2-2').
